oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bulk Tank Raw Milk Quality: On-farm Assessment of Risk Factors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: ElMoslemany, Ahmed
Keefe, Greg
Dohoo, Ian
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bulk tank milk
on-farm risks
bacteria burden
bacteriological quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Raw bulk tank milk (BTM) quality (SCC and bacteria burden) is used to quantify the health and safety of milk and is associated with consumer acceptance of milk products. No case-control study examining specific on-farm risks for decreased milk quality (increased bacteria burden) has been conducted. The objective of this study was to determine on-farm risk factors for overall and class specific bacteriological quality of bulk tank milk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 225
